Since the maximum input is up to, say, 1e9 (if the second step's output is up to that), the digits array of 20 is sufficient. Now, writing the code:

program main

    implicit none

    character(len=1000) :: input_str
    character(len=1000) :: stack
    integer :: c = 0, top = 0, i, n, result1, a1 = 0, a2 = 0
    character(len=20) :: result1_str, a, b
    integer :: result2, newNumber = 0
    integer, dimension(20) :: digits
    integer :: n_digits = 0, x

    ! Read input
    read(*,'(a)', advance='no') input_str
    input_str = adjustl(input_str)

    ! First algorithm
    n = len_trim(input_str)
    do i = 1, n
        character :: current_char = input_str(i:i)
        top = top + 1
        stack(top:top) = current_char
        do while (top >= 2)
            character :: p = stack(top:top)
            character :: q = stack(top-1:top-1)
            if ((p == '1' .and. q == '0') .or. (p == '0' .and. q == '1')) then
                c = c + 1
                top = top - 2
            else
                exit
            end if
        end do
    end do
    result1 = c * 2

    ! Convert result1 to string
    write(result1_str, '(i0)') result1
    result1_str = adjustl(result1_str)

    ! Second algorithm
    a = result1_str
    b = result1_str

    ! Compute a1
    do i = 2, len_trim(a)
        if (a(i:i) == a(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (a(i:i) == '1') then
                a(i:i) = '0'
            else
                a(i:i) = '1'
            end if
            a1 = a1 + 1
        end if
    end do

    ! Compute a2
    do i = len_trim(b), 2, -1
        if (b(i:i) == b(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (b(i-1:i-1) == '1') then
                b(i-1:i-1) = '0'
            else
                b(i-1:i-1) = '1'
            end if
            a2 = a2 + 1
        end if
    end do

    result2 = min(a1, a2)

    ! Third algorithm
    x = result2
    n_digits = 0
    do while (x > 0)
        integer :: r = mod(x, 10)
        integer :: digit
        if (9 - r < r) then
            if (x / 10 == 0 .and. (9 - r) == 0) then
                digit = r
            else
                digit = 9 - r
            end if
        else
            digit = r
        end if
        n_digits = n_digits + 1
        digits(n_digits) = digit
        x = x / 10
    end do

    newNumber = 0 do i = 1, n_digits
        newNumber = newNumber * 10 + digits(i)
    end do

    !
children.label: code_analysis

children.text:
Output the result
    print*, newNumber

end program main

program main

    implicit none

    character(len=1000) :: input_str
    character(len=1000) :: stack
    integer :: c = 0, top = 0, i, n, result1, a1 = 0, a2 = 0
    character(len=20) :: result1_str, a, b
    integer :: result2, newNumber = 0
    integer, dimension(20) :: digits
    integer :: n_digits = 0, x

    ! Read input
    read(*,'(a)', advance='no') input_str
    input_str = adjustl(input_str)

    ! First algorithm
    n = len_trim(input_str)
    do i = 1, n
        character :: current_char = input_str(i:i)
        top = top + 1
        stack(top:top) = current_char
        do while (top >= 2)
            character :: p = stack(top:top)
            character :: q = stack(top-1:top-1)
            if ((p == '1' .and. q == '0') .or. (p == '0' .and. q == '1')) then
                c = c + 1
                top = top - 2
            else
                exit
            end if
        end do
    end do
    result1 = c * 2

    ! Convert result1 to string
    write(result1_str, '(i0)') result1
    result1_str = adjustl(result1_str)

    ! Second algorithm
    a = result1_str
    b = result1_str

    ! Compute a1
    do i = 2, len_trim(a)
        if (a(i:i) == a(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (a(i:i) == '1') then
                a(i:i) = '0'
            else
                a(i:i) = '1'
            end if
            a1 = a1 + 1
        end if
    end do

    ! Compute a2
    do i = len_trim(b), 2, -1
        if (b(i:i) == b(i-1:i-1)) then
            if (b(i-1:i-1) == '1') then
                b(i-1:i-1) = '0'
            else
                b(i-1:i-1) = '1'
            end if
            a2 = a2 + 1
        end if
    end do

    result2 = min(a1, a2)

    ! Third algorithm
    x = result2
    n_digits = 0
    do while (x > 0)
        integer :: r = mod(x, 10)
        integer :: digit
        if (9 - r < r) then
            if (x / 10 == 0 .and. (9 - r) == 0) then
                digit = r
            else
                digit = 9 - r
            end if
        else
            digit = r
        end if
        n_digits = n_digits + 1
        digits(n_digits) = digit
        x = x / 10
    end do

    newNumber = 0
    do i = 1, n_digits
        newNumber = newNumber * 10 + digits(i)
    end do

    ! Output the result
    print*, newNumber

end program main
